pci_projects_project_kubernetes_details_: Configure the OIDC provider

You can use most OIDC providers like Dex, Keycloak or a SaaS provider, provided that they expose the “OpenID Connect discovery” feature. The OIDC provider must be accessible from a HTTPS URL, and a signed CA certificate is mandatory.
Add
Cancel
Provider URL (required)
Enter your provider's discovery URL here, without a path. The URL must point to the previous level of .well-known/openid-configuration. You must use a URL starting with https://
Client ID (required)

Enter the Kubernetes cluster ID here from your OIDC provider, e.g. "cluster-kubernetes-production". This is the character string of your choice (note that some OIDC providers may be more restrictive).
The OIDC settings have been processed. They will be effective once your API server is redeployed, usually within 30 seconds.
An error has occurred creating the OIDC provider: {{message}}

The issuer URL must be a valid URL.
The issuer URL must use HTTPS protocol.

You can use most OIDC providers like Dex, Keycloak or a SaaS provider, provided that they expose the “OpenID Connect discovery” feature. The OIDC provider must be accessible from a HTTPS URL, and a signed CA certificate is mandatory.
Enter your provider's discovery URL here, without a path. The URL must point to the previous level of .well-known/openid-configuration. You must use a URL starting with https://

Enter the Kubernetes cluster ID here from your OIDC provider, e.g. "cluster-kubernetes-production". This is the character string of your choice (note that some OIDC providers may be more restrictive).
usernameClaim (Optional)

Claim JWT to be used as username. By default, this is "sub", which is supposed to be a unique identifier for the end user. Administrators can choose other claims, such as email or name, depending on their provider. However, claims other than email will be prefixed by the issuer URL (Provider URL) to avoid name conflicts with other plugins.
usernamePrefix (optional)

A prefix added to user name claims to avoid conflicts with existing names (such as system:users). For example, the value oidc: will create usernames like oidc:jane.doe. If this field is not set and usernameClaim has a value other than email, the default prefix will be (Issuer URL)# where (Issuer URL) is the value of Provider URL. The "-" value can be used to disable any prefix.
groupsClaim (optional)
The JWT claim to use as the user group. If the claim is used, it must be a table of character strings.
groupsPrefix (optional)
A prefix added to group claims (groupsClaim) to avoid conflicts with existing names (such as system:groups). For example, the value oidc: will create group names like oidc:engineering and oidc:infra.
requiredClaim (optional)
Key=value pairs that describe the claims required in the ID token. If defined, the claims are verified to be included in the ID token with a corresponding value.
signingAlgorithms (optional)
Accepted signature algorithms. By default, it is recommended to use the "RS256" algorithm.
caContent (optional)
The content of the certificate authority (CA) certificate, in base64 format, that signed your ID provider's web certificate. By default, uses the host's root CA.
